title: County natives honored by MIAA
text:
County natives honored by MIAA Livingston Daily 10:06 p.m. EDT October 12, 2015 Meyer CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
HOLLAND Two Hope College athletes with Livingston County ties were honored by the Michigan Intercollegiate Athletic Association Monday for their performances last week. 
Darren Ford of Howell, a kicker on the Hope football team, was named the MIAA Special Teams Player of the Week. Ford, who spent last season at Saginaw Valley, kicked two field goals and four extra points in the Flying Dutchmen's 34-0 win over Rockford (Ill). 
Ford was Howell's kicker for three season and its quarterback in 2013 while also excelling on the baseball team. 
In addition, Brighton grad Nicole Meyer was named the MIAA's Golfer of the Week. 
A sophomore, Meyer was the medalist at last weekend's MIAA jamboree. She shot a 2-over 74 on Saturday as Hope repeated as MIAA champion and won its eighth title overall. 
Meyer also was named to the All-MIAA first team, averaging 81.17 strokes per round, good for fourth in the MIAA. 
Volleyball 
Fowlerville 3, Eaton Rapids 0 
EATON RAPIDS The Gladiators (15-15-3) improved to 4-3 in the CAAC White after beating the Greyhounds for the second time this season. 
"We had better serving (Monday) and our hitters were coming through," Fowlerville coach Michelle Hardenbrook said. "It was a better showing for us." 
Sara Domine had 15 digs and 12 points for the Glads, while Bre Ray had 12 points, Paige Temple 18 assists and Erin Vielbig and Leah Ash eight kills apiece for Fowlerville. 
Soccer 
Brighton 3, Walled Lake Central 2 
WALLED LAKE Ian Sosenko scored the game-winning goal with about five minutes to go to lift the Bulldogs (8-6-3) in the Lakes Conference crossover game. 
Steven Hall and Garrett Bowles scored in the first half for Brighton, which led 2-1 at halftime. Walled Lake Central tied the game in the second half before Sosenko's game-winner. 
"We hung tough and kept playing our game," Brighton assistant coach Nate Grabowski said. "It was a good team win." 
The Bulldogs will play host to either Salem or Plymouth on Wednesday. Read or Share this story: http://ldpaa.com/1RDBw9p TOP VIDEOS
